Detailed Description

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum DzMatrixParam::MatrixProps

Represents different properties in the matrix

Enumerator:
TransX 

Represents the X Translate property in the matrix

TransY 

Represents the Y Translate property in the matrix

TransZ 

Represents the Z Translate property in the matrix

RotX 

Represents the X Rotate property in the matrix

RotY 

Represents the Y Rotate property in the matrix

RotZ 

Represents the Z Rotate property in the matrix

ScaleX 

Represents the X Scale property in the matrix

ScaleY 

Represents the Y Scale property in the matrix

ScaleZ 

Represents the Z Scale property in the matrix

Scale 

Represents the General Scale property in the matrix

virtual int DzMatrixParam::getPropertyMapToken ( int  i  )  const [inline, virtual, slot]
Parameters:
i the index of map token to get
Returns:
the index in the token set for the map token. This is only valid if the property at the index is a mapped numeric property.

DzNumericProperty, DzPropertyParam

void DzMatrixParam::loadSection ( DzInFile *  file,
short  sectionID 
) [virtual]

Called by the framework to allow this object to load data for the given section. Derived classes override this method to read section data from the native file format.

Parameters:
file The file to read from
sectionID The section ID of the section to read.

Reimplemented from DzBrickParam.

void DzMatrixParam::setDirection ( int  i  )  [virtual, slot]
Parameters:
i The direction for the param, should be either DzBrickParam::None (0) or DzBrickParam::In (1)
void DzMatrixParam::setPointer ( const DzInFile *  file,
short  sectionID,
short  pointerID,
DzBase *  ptr 
) [virtual]

Called by the framework when reading a native file. Derived classes should override this method if they ever write out pointer values to the data file. This method will be called with the sectionID and pointerID that were given when writing the file out. The passed pointer may be shared so should not be deleted.

Parameters:
file The file being loaded
sectionID The ID of the file section being read
pointerID The ID of the pointer being read.
ptr The pointer being read.

Reimplemented from DzBrickParam.
